body: Maybe we should add a default factory method to the `HonoClient` interface, very much like vert.x does it all over the place ...
Yes, this will solve the issue and will improve even non-OSGi usage. Then there will be no need of using impl classes directly - better API

Ok for this to work the "builder" would need to be in the same package as `HonoClient`. Right now that would create an asymmetry between `HonoClient` and `HonoConnection`. The latter one has an "Impl" class on the same package as the interface.

I would add the builder for `HonoClient` to the interface and move the builder in `HonoConnectionImpl` to the interface as well. Moving `HonoConnectionImpl` to an "impl" package as well.

Would that work for everyone?!
Well that would ignore the case of using an explicit `ConnectionFactory`.
I just pushed the (unfinished!) branch of the changes I had in mind.
Ok, pushed again without the code formatter changes.
The javadoc part and the refactoring of the "ConnectionBuilder" is still missing of course.

issue.title: #586 Fix OSGi client instantiation
issue.body: This PR fixes the OSGi client instatiation issue reported in #586. I also aligns both pattern of the `HonoClient` and `ConnectionFactory`.
